info.title: Consumer Loan APIs Specifications
info.description:
## Introduction There are 7 API services in this group for Loan APIs.
1. Loan Listing to retrieve loan relationship master details
2. Loan Details to retrieve loan enquiry balance details
3. Loan Statements to retrieve single Loan Statement deails
4. Loan Delinquencies to retrieve all delinquency details
5. Loan Repayment Schedule to retrieve repayment schedule according to request
6. Interest certificate
7. Transaction posting[repayment]
## Encryption and Signing Encryption and Signing uses JSON Web Tokens (JWT), an open industry standard RFC7519 method to represent claims securely across two parties. ### Algorithms SCB provides support for the beLow-mentioned algorithms, which are specified in the JOSE Header, as per JSON Web Signature (JWS) and JSON Web Encryption (JWE) Standards.
Standard Algorithm JOSE Header
JSON Web Signature (JWS) ES256 kid: (key id) cty: JWS alg: ES256
JSON Web Encryption (JWE) RSA-OAEP-256 (Asymmetric) kid: (key id) cty: JWT alg: RSA-OAEP-256
## Guide for JWE and JWS As per SCB API Security standards, SCB uses Compact Serialization for its JWS/JWE representation. The content to be sent to the client is first signed folLowing JWS specifications and then encrypted and sent as a JWE to the client. Specifics for creating each component are as shown beLow: ### JSON Web Signature The folLowing describes the structure of our JWS. **Message** : Content to be sent to client **JWS Payload** : BASE64URL-ENCODE(Message) **Signature** : ASCII(BASE64URL-ENCODE(UTF8(JOSE Header))‘.’BASE64URL-ENCODE(JWS Payload)) **Structure** : BASE64URL(UTF8(JOSE Header))‘.’BASE64URL(JWS Payload)‘.’BASE64URL(JWS Signature)
### JSON Web Encryption The folLowing describes the structure of our JWE. The payload in our JWE is the JWS we have created in the steps above. The JOSE header of JWE contains both symmetric and asymmetric encryptions. Symmetric encryption to encrypt the payload, and assymetric encryption to encrypt the symmetric key. The assymetric keypair belongs to the client who will be receiving the JWE. **JWE Payload** : JWS Signature (from above) **JWE Ciphertext** : *ENCRYPT-SYMMETRIC*(JWE Payload) **JWE Encrypted Key** : *ENCRYPT-ASYMMETRIC*(Symmetric Key) - using client's public key **Structure** : BASE64URL-ENCODE(UTF8(JWE Header))‘.’BASE64URL-ENCODE(JWE Encrypted Key)‘.’BASE64URL-ENCODE(JWE Initialization Vector)‘.’BASE64URL-ENCODE(JWE Ciphertext)‘.’BASE64URL-ENCODE(JWE Authentication Tag) ## API Response Codes
Response Code Response Message HTTP status
E001 Field is mandatory 400
E002 Field value not in valid range 400
E003 Invalid Format 400
E004 Contains invalid characters 400
E005 Resource not found 404
E006 No unique resource found 400
E100 Unable to decrypt 500
E101 Unable to verify signature 500
E102 Unable to decrypt or verify signature 500
E103 Unable to encrypt 500
E104 Unable to sign 500
E105 Unable to encrypt or sign 500
E110 Invalid MTLS Cert 400
E111 Invalid Token Error 401
E112 Forbidden 403
E200 Downstream System Error 500
E201 Internal API Gateway Error 500
E202 Timeout Error 500
E300 Modify request as message is too large 413
E999 Unexpected error occurred 500

get.description: Retrieve loan listing based on details provided

parameters.name: Transaction-Id
parameters.description: Unique transaction reference identifier for the API request, for tracking purposes

parameters.name: X-Forwarded-For
parameters.description: IP address which the request originated from, segregated by commas. \<user ip>, \<server ip> etc

parameters.name: X-Market
parameters.description: Indicate the specific Market or Country for which this operation is performed. Value should be a 2-char ISO-3166 country code.

parameters.name: version
parameters.description: version of the API

parameters.name: profile-id
parameters.description:
Tokenised profile ID of the customer
One of the below query parameters is required:
1. profile-id
2. loan-ids

parameters.description:
List of tokenised loan ID's
One of the below query parameters is required:
1. profile-id
2. loan-ids

profile-id.description: Tokenised profile ID of the customer

type.description:
Customer type
Code Description
PPrimary borrower
SSecondary borrower
MMortgagor
GGuarantor

Identify the loan
Code Description
MMortgage
IInstalment
DDiscretionary
example: "M"

security-indicator.description:
This field indicate security indicator
Code Description
Ssecured loan
Cclean loan
Ppartially secured
Oothers

date.description: The date the loan application was completed by the applicant,  as keyed at the time of account creation in YYYY-MM-DD format.

amount.description: The original loan application amount at the time the application is received.  Note that this amount may vary from the amount actually approved or advanced.  Also as Tax Pleaser First Phase Scheduled Drawdown Amount

tenor.description: The original tenor at the time the application is received. Note that this may vary from the tenor approved

date.description: The date the loan was approved in YYYY-MM-DD format.

amount.description: Approved amount for the loan. Also as Tax Pleaser Approved First Phase Amount

tenor.description: The number of installment approved for this loan

date.description: The date the loan was last approved in YYYY-MM-DD format.

amount.description: Last approved amount for the loan.

date.description: The date the loan was last topup in YYYY-MM-DD format.

amount.description: Last topup amount for the loan.

discharge-date.description: The date the loan was closed in YYYY-MM-DD format.

accumulate-tenor.description: The field reflects the number of repayment dues from the first drawdown to the current period

due-cycle-day.description: Day of the due date. If this day is different from the day of the drawdown date upon loan creation,  it is used in determining the due date of the loan account.

instalment.description: The installment constant is the total amount to be raised as due on the loan due date for loan using straight line repayment method.

last-advance-date.description: The date the most recent advance was made on the loan account in YYYY-MM-DD format.

first-interest-due-date.description: The date upon which the first interest amount will be raised as due in YYYY-MM-DD format.

last-interest-due-date.description: The date the last interest amount was raised as due in YYYY-MM-DD format.

next-interest-due-date.description: The date the system will next raise the interest portion of the installment amount as due in YYYY-MM-DD format.

final-interest-due-date.description: The expected date, based upon the term of the loan, upon which the final interest amount will be raised as due.  It is also used as the maturity date of the loan account in YYYY-MM-DD format.

interest-due-frequency.description: The frequency with which expected interest payments are raised as due.

advance-amount.description: The total amount advanced to date for this loan

schedule-amount.description: This contains the outstanding principal amount assuming that no arrears amount will be added to the loan.  Principal portion is deducted from this amount each time the principal due is raised

current-arrear.description: Current Arrear amount that have not paid after due

open-date.description: The date the loan was opened in YYYY-MM-DD format.

classification.description: Categorization identifier, within which all loans are classified in accordance with system installation configuration parameters

advance-account.description: The CASA account to which loan will generate a direct credit request during loan drawdown

loan-limit.description: The loan limit amount field is defaulted from the Product record at account creation time, if applicable. It is used to validate that the application amount does not exceed the specified limit amount for this group.

max-tenor.description: Maximum tenor the loan can have. It is used for checking during re-amortization.

principal-due-frequency.description: The frequency with which expected principal repayments are raised as due. ie update the arrears/advance balance, and the appropriate appropriation balance, as designated by the UCF transaction type record for principal dues

first-principal-due.description: The date upon which the first principal amount will be raised as due in YYYY-MM-DD format.

last-principal-due.description: The date the last principal amount was raised as due in YYYY-MM-DD format.

final-principal-due.description: The expected date, based upon the term of the loan, upon which the final principal amount will be raised as due in YYYY-MM-DD format.

next-principal-due.description: The date the system will next raise the principal portion of the installment amount as due in YYYY-MM-DD format.

instalment-interest.description: Installment interest holds the portion of the installment amount relating to interest as at the last due date.

instalment-principal.description: Installment principal holds the portion of the installment amount relating to principal as at the last due date. For reducing balance, this is the fixed principal portion of monthly installment.

next-instalment.description: After reamortization, this field stores the next installment.

interest-calculation-indicator.description:
Interest calculation indicator
Code Description
DDaily Calculate
MMonthly Calculate
OInterest 360 Days Calculate
FInterest 365 Days Calculate

product-group.description:
Identify the loan
Code Description
MMortgage
IInstalment
DDiscretionary

last-approved-amount.description: Last approved amount for the loan.

last-topup-amount.description: Last topup amount for the loan.

advance-amount.description: The total amount advanced to date for this loan

schedule-amount.description: This contains the outstanding principal amount assuming that no arrears amount will be added to the loan.  Principal portion is deducted from this amount each time the principal due is raised

current-arrear.description: Current Arrear amount that have not paid after due

instalment-interest.description: Installment interest holds the portion of the installment amount relating to interest as at the last due date.

instalment-principal.description: Installment principal holds the portion of the installment amount relating to principal as at the last due date. For reducing balance, this is the fixed principal portion of monthly installment.

next-instalment.description: After reamortization, this field stores the next installment.

profile-id.description: Tokenised profile ID of the customer

statement-date.description: Document of the due date of balance in YYYY-MM-DD format

loan-balance.description: Current Loan balance of the loan as of the closing of the statement date

schedule-balance.description: Schedule balance of the loan as of the closing of the statement date

arrear-balance.description: Arrear balance of the loan as of the closing of the statement date

interest-in-arrears.description: Interest in arrear of the loan as of the closing of the statement date

principal-in-arrears.description: Principal in arrear of the loan as of the closing of the statement date

late-charge-in-arrears.description: Late charge in arrear of the loan as of the closing of the statement date

insurance-in-arrears.description: Insurance in arrear of the loan as of the closing of the statement date

fee-in-arrears.description: Fee in arrear of the loan as of the closing of the statement date

bounce-charge-in-arrears.description: Bounce charge in arrear of the loan as of the closing of the statement date

subsidy-interest-in-arrears.description: Subsidy interest in arrear of the loan as of the closing of the statement date

surplus-in-arrears.description: Surplus in arrear of the loan as of the closing of the statement date

payment-received.description: Payment received of the loan as of the closing of the statement date

interest-in-received.description: Interest in received of the loan as of the closing of the statement date

principal-in-received.description: Principal in received of the loan as of the closing of the statement date

late-charge-in-received.description: Late charge in received of the loan as of the closing of the statement date

insurance-in-received.description: Insurance in received of the loan as of the closing of the statement date

fee-in-received.description: Fee in received of the loan as of the closing of the statement date

bounce-charge-in-received.description: Bounce charge in received of the loan as of the closing of the statement date

subsidy-interest-in-received.description: Subsidy interest in received of the loan as of the closing of the statement date

surplus-in-received.description: Surplus in received of the loan as of the closing of the statement date

profile-id.description: Tokenised profile ID of the customer

loan-id.description: Tokenised Loan ID of the customer

interest-in-arrears.description: Interest amount due by not yet paid

principal-in-arrears.description: Principal amount due by not yet paid

late-charge-in-arrears.description: Late Charge amount due by not yet paid

insurance-in-arrears.description: Insurance premium due by not yet paid

fee-in-arrears.description: Miscellaneous fee due by not yet paid

bounce-charge-in-arrears.description: Bounce charge due by not yet paid

subsidy-interest-in-arrears.description: Subsidy interest due by not yet paid. This is the company interest subsidy. This will only be updated by the company subsidy payment

surplus-in-arrears.description: The surplus of the credit amount after all the previous appropriation balances are settled

write-off-amount.description: To indicate the charge-off amount for charge-off loan only

write-off-date.description: To indicate the charge-off date in YYYY-MM-DD format

charge-off-reason.description:
The reason to charge off the specific loan
Code Description
C CREDIT LOSS
B BANKRUPTCY
F FRAUD LOSS
T COUNTERFEIT
D DECEASED
S DISPOSAL
A DUAL CHRG OFF
I IVA
R RESTRUCTURE
Y AUTO REPOSIT
X SKIP
Z OTHERS

last-payment-date.description: The date of last payment transaction applied to this loan in YYYY-MM-DD format

last-payment-amount.description: The amount of last payment transaction

current-aging-code.description: A set of alphabetic codes to indicate number of current instalment in arrears. (i.e ‘A’ = not in arrears, ‘B’ = 1 instalment in arrears, ‘C’ = 2 instalment in arears...)

aging-code.description:
Aging code for last instalment
Code Description
A not in arrears1
B 1 installment in arrears
C 2 installment in arrears
D 3 installment in arrears
E 4 installment in arrears
F 5 installment in arrears
G 6 installment in arrears
H 7 installment in arrears
I 8 installment in arrears
J 9 installment in arrears
K 10 installment in arrears
L 11 installment in arrears
M 12 installment in arrears
N 13 installment in arrears
O 14 installment in arrears
P 15 installment in arrears
Q 16 installment in arrears
R 17 installment in arrears
S 18 installment in arrears
T 19 installment in arrears
U 20 installment in arrears
V 21 installment in arrears
W 22 installment in arrears
X 23 installment in arrears
Y 24 installment in arrears
Z 25 installment in arrears

payment-due-date.description: nth last payment due date in YYYY-MM-DD format

aging-arrears-amount.description: nth last instalment aging arrears amount

day-past-due.description: Number of day past due date loan having arrears

times-to-credit-control.description: Times this loan report to credit control

profile-id.description:
Tokenised profile ID of the customer
One of the below query parameters is required
1. profile-id
2. loan-id

List of tokenised loan ID
One of the below query parameters is required
1. profile-id
2. loan-id

start-date.description: start date of the loan repayment schedule in YYYY-MM-DD format

end-date.description: end date of the loan repayment schedule in YYYY-MM-DD format

loan-balance.description: The loan balance for repayment schedule projection

interest-rate.description: Interest rate to use for repayment schedule projection

employee-rate.description: Employee rate to use for repayment schedule projection

amortization-option.description:
Amortization option to project repayment schedule- A complete schedule of periodic blended loan payments showing the amount of principal and the amount of interest Amortization-option
Code Description
1 Straight Line
2 Reducing Balance
3 Rule 78
4 True Flat

interest-indicator.description:
Used to daily or monthly rest to calculate interest Interest-indicator
Code Description
D Daily
M Monthly

instalment-frequency.description:
frequency of instalment
Code Description
W Weekly
F Fort Weekly
M Monthly
Q Quaterly
H Half Yearly
Y Yearly

tenor.description: If present tenor should not pass use tenor for repayment schedule projection

instalment.description: If present instalment should not pass use instalment for repayment schedule projection

interest-only-start-date.description: The start date of interest in YYYY-MM-DD format

interest-only-period.description: The period of interest only, if present interest only end date should not be pass

interest-only-end-date.description: The end date of interest only, if present interest only period should not be pass in YYYY-MM-DD format

top-up-amount.description: project repayment schedule after top up is perform

preset-safety-limit-indicator.description:
Use preset safety limit to project repayment schedule.This is specific to MortgageOne account(MOA) loan products
Code Description
Y Yes
N No

round-off.description:
Round-off(total) the instalment amount
Code Description
Y Yes
N No
